question: Device turns on?
details: Lights, displays, and sounds are signs the device is powered on.

question: Troubleshoot Power Supply
details: Feeding pumps generally have an AC-DC power supply.

question: Replace battery if necessary
details: Old batteries are a common problem with feeding pumps. Test battery's ability to receive and hold a charge.

question: Device runs on battery only? (No AC)
details: Check if the machine will run on battery when power is unplugged. This is a safety feature on many feeding pumps.

question: Pump creates correct flow rate?
details: Measure the flow rate using a container of known- volume to collect the fluid and a stopwatch. Flow rate is volume divided by time.

question: Does occlusion alarm sound when output tube is pinched?
details: When the output tube is occluded, the machine should sound.

question: Is flow rate zero?
details: Check if the machine will generate any output of fluid.

question: Verify casette is properly attached (if applicable)
details: An improperly loaded cassette or pump set might leak fluid after the device is turned off.

question: Correct leaks in tubing
details: See BTA skill on plumbing leaks.

question: Repair or replace free-flow valve if necessary
details: Insure the free-flow valve is working properly and clean or adjust the free flow valve mechanically as necessary.

question: Is machine always silent?
details: Investigate if machine makes noises due to any other inputs or alarms.

question: Flow ceases when pump is off?
details: When the flow is turned off by unplugging the machine or with user controls, verify that the fluid output stops.

question: See BTA skills on electric connections and connectors.
Check if machine is in silent mode
details: Silent mode may be preventing the alarm. Turn off silent mode and check alarm again.

question: Replace/calibrate occlusion sensor
details: See BTA skills on electric connections and connectors. Consider replacing sensor if it cannot be repaired.

question: Replace speaker
details: Machine is not in silent mode, but it does not make noise. Replace the speaker.

question: Verify free-flow valve is open
details: The free-flow valve must be open to allow fluid output. Insure the valve is working properly and clean it or adjust it mechanically if necessary.

question: Verify cassette is properly attached (if applicable)
details: An improperly loaded cassette or pump set can prevent any fluid output.

question: Check for any leaks inside machine
details: A leak in the tubing can cause a spill and prevent flow. See BTA skills on plumbing leaks.

question: Repair or replace cassette or peristalic actuators if necessary
details: Some feeding pumps use a cassette or pump set as an accessory that must be changed and refilled periodically. Sometimes the cassette must be “primed” or “reset” after refilling. Use the menu options on the machine to reset the cassette. Peristaltic pumps use rollers that are controlled and moved by electromechanical actuators. Lubricate or replace the actuators as necessary.

question: Is flow rate zero?
details: Check if the machine will generate any output of fluid.

question: Check for leaks in tubing
details: Tubing leaks can cause low flow rate. See BTA skills on plumbing leaks.

question: Is flow rate too high?
details: Compare the measured flow rate to the amount programmed in the machine.

question: Verify free flow valve closes when door is open
details: Some feeding pumps, especially peristaltic feeding pumps, have a free-flow valve that closes to prevent flow when the machine case is open. Ensure the valve is working properly and clean it or adjust it mechanically if necessary.

question: Change cassette (if applicable)
details: Some feeding pumps use a cassette or pump set as an accessory that must be changed and refilled periodically. Sometimes the cassette must be “primed” or “reset” after refilling. Use the menu options on the machine to reset the cassette

question: Change cassette (if applicable)
details: Some feeding pumps use a cassette or pump set as an accessory that must be changed and refilled periodically. Sometimes the cassette must be “primed” or “reset” after refilling. Use the menu options on the machine to reset the cassette.

question: Replace/calibrate any flow sensors
details: Incorrect flow rates can be caused by faulty or disconnected flow sensors. See BTA skill on electrical connections and connecters.

question: Replace/calibrate any flow sensors
details: Incorrect flow rates can be caused by faulty or disconnected flow sensors. See BTA skill on electrical connections and connecters.

question: Adjust rollers to ensure proper distance from tube (for peristalic pump)
details: For peristaltic feeding pumps, incorrect flow rates can result from rollers that are either too far or too close to the tube.
